title: Xprim777
author: Xprim777
content: Hello, I would like to sell these 2 Polymerbit notesLot 1: 0.2 BTC #32/50A very nice Polymerbit note from 2016, made with teslin paper. 50 notes were made. Lot 2: 0.2 BTC Test V2 #A0722This note is a test made with polymer paper from 06-2017, numbered A0722. I don't know how many of them are in circulation. A variant of the 0.2 BTC test note does exist but without serial number. Starting bid per lot: 0.001 BTCMinimum bid increments on each lot : 0.0001 BTC End time : Sunday 17th September 2023, 23h UTC+2 (Paris time) - Countdown TimerSniping : Bids within 10 minutes before the auction end extend the auction for 10 minutes.Payment : 3J99EqYbzmPo3VgtXyga9TWuuWxgLy5QawShipping : $10 worldwide with trackingEscrow accepted, winner pays fees.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Damn. I have been wondering when one or more of these would appear someday. I have both as well. GL to you Xprim I hope it does well. I recall paying quite a bit for these back in the day when btc was very low, straight from zepher when we were at coinfest2018 manchester (Likely purchased from Daniele that day lol).

comments.author: Xprim777
comments.body: 2 days left, don't miss out these rare notes !

comments.author: polymerbit
comments.body: The custom serial number caught our attention. We can confirm Lot 2 is actually a 1 of 1. It was made a gift in 2017, as a unique request. This is one of the earliest notes printed in-house on polymer. We got our polymer printers in June 2017. ----Lot one was also printed in house, but it is printed on teslin and uses a now obsolete print method.

comments.author: Xprim777
comments.created_time: September 15, 2023, 11:00:00 PMLast edit: September 16, 2023, 09:10:59 AM by Xprim777
comments.body: Quote from: polymerbit on September 15, 2023, 09:20:46 PMThe custom serial number caught our attention. We can confirm Lot 2 is actually a 1 of 1. It was made a gift in 2017, as a unique request. This is one of the earliest notes printed in-house on polymer. We got our polymer printers in June 2017. ----Lot one was also printed in house, but it is printed on teslin and uses a now obsolete print method. Thanks a lot for these informations ! I didn't know it is a 1/1 as I'm not the original owner. Nice piece of Polymerbit history
